Package Game2048.Component

Class Cell

java.lang.Object
Game2048.Component.Cell
public class Cell extends Object
This is a class that contains all the information about the cells.

  • Constructor Details

    • Cell

      public Cell(double x, double y, double scale, javafx.scene.Group root)
      Create the cells into the pane.
      Parameters:
      x - is to initial the coordinates of the cells.
      y - is also used to initial the coordinates of the cells.
      scale - is the initial length of the size of the cell.
      root - is a group for the game root, and used to add the cell into game scene.

  • Method Details

    • getModify

      public boolean getModify()
      Check whether the number of the cell is changed or not.
      Returns:
      the cells' modify status.

    • setModify

      public void setModify(boolean modify)

    • changeCell

      public void changeCell(Cell cell)
      Change all parameters of the cell.
      Parameters:
      cell - is a cell needed to change.

    • adder

      public void adder(Cell cell)
      Add the same number into one cell, and set another cell into 0.
      Parameters:
      cell - is the cell that need to be added number.

    • setColorByNumber

      public void setColorByNumber(int number)
      Fill different colors with different numbers, whenever new numbers are generated, the color of the cells will be changed to the relation colors depends on the number of the cells contain.
      Parameters:
      number - is the parameter that cells contain, and different numbers have different colors.

    • getX

      public double getX()
      Get the length of the sides of the cells.
      Returns:
      the number of the length.

    • getY

      public double getY()
      Get the wide of the sides of the cells.
      Returns:
      the number of the wide.

    • getNumber

      public int getNumber()
      Get the string number of the cell.
      Returns:
      the number of the cell in integer.

    • setTextClass

      public void setTextClass(javafx.scene.text.Text textClass)
